page.title: 18Wildlife & Yetholm Loch
page.content: This wildlife reserve is the result of an agreement between Scottish Wildlife Trust and three landowners, after the Nature Conservancy Council had recommended the site of special scientific interest. Signposts discourage visitors, at the south end of the loch, birds nesting include, the willow and the sedge warblers, reed bunting and other visiting song birds. One of the landowners, keen on planting trees has improved the west area for wildlife by willow and alder thickets native trees offering shelter and food to small birds. Winter visitors include, mallard, teal, wigeon, goldeneye, pochard, tufted duck, goosander with whooper swans, greylag or pinkfoot geese seen if you are lucky. Rarer are shoveler, pintail and long tailed duck.
